meanings.definition: To convert (an image or graphic) into a vector format.
meanings.sent1: I will vectorize the logo to make it scalable.
meanings.sent2: Graphic designers often vectorize images for better quality.
meanings.sent3: I tried to vectorize a photo of my cat, but now it looks like a cartoon!
meanings.sent4: She managed to vectorize her thoughts into a clear plan of action.
meanings.sent5: The artist's ability to vectorize landscapes brought them to life on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To represent (a quantity) as a vector.
meanings.sent1: Let's vectorize the velocity of the car for analysis.
meanings.sent2: In physics, it's common to vectorize forces for calculations.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally vectorized the speed of my running shoes - now they seem faster!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was vectorized in her focused gaze.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used diagrams to help students understand how to vectorize data effectively.

meanings.definition: To change (a program or algorithm) to operate on vectors.
meanings.sent1: The software engineer will vectorize the code for better performance.
meanings.sent2: It's important to vectorize algorithms for efficient processing.
meanings.sent3: When I tried to vectorize the program, it started solving math problems on its own!
meanings.sent4: His ability to vectorize complex problems made him a sought-after programmer.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's breakthrough was to vectorize the algorithm, revolutionizing data analysis.
